name: Scholz conjecture
rephrased: The shortest addition chain for a number n has a length no more than roughly twice the logarithm base 2 of n.
implication_form: If n is a positive integer, then the minimal length of an addition chain for n is at most log₂(2n-1) + 1.
explained: The Scholz conjecture is an unsolved problem in mathematics that states for any positive integer \(n\), the length of the shortest addition chain for \(2^{n}-1\) is less than or equal to the length of the shortest addition chain for \(n\) plus \(n-1\). In simpler terms, it proposes an upper bound on how difficult it is to construct a sequence of numbers to produce \(2^{n}-1\), suggesting it's only slightly more complex than producing \(n\).
